channel.title: Comments on: Exploring Functions (and Non-Functions) Interactively
channel.description: iteration, making, building, and coding in education

item.title: By: Xavier
item.dc:creator: Xavier
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2016/04/29/exploring-functions-and-non-functions-interactively/#comment-455">Evan Weinberg</a>.
Thanks a lot, Evan.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Evan Weinberg.

Thanks a lot, Evan.

item.title: By: Evan Weinberg
item.dc:creator: Evan Weinberg
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2016/04/29/exploring-functions-and-non-functions-interactively/#comment-455">Evan Weinberg</a>.
Never mind - I figured out it was a window sizing issue. I haven't played with the helper classes on the input for the medium size browser window to fix this.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Evan Weinberg.

Never mind – I figured out it was a window sizing issue. I haven’t played with the helper classes on the input for the medium size browser window to fix this.

item.title: By: Evan Weinberg
item.dc:creator: Evan Weinberg
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2016/04/29/exploring-functions-and-non-functions-interactively/#comment-454">Xavier</a>.
This is great Xavier - I'll have to dig into the details on how to reproduce the Chrome bug. At the moment it seems to be working fine on my end, unless I'm not actually understanding the issues you found.
I also added an MIT license - mix it up as much as you want and share away.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Xavier.

This is great Xavier – I’ll have to dig into the details on how to reproduce the Chrome bug. At the moment it seems to be working fine on my end, unless I’m not actually understanding the issues you found.

I also added an MIT license – mix it up as much as you want and share away.
